column1: An orbit is the path that an object takes in space when it goes around a star
column3: or a moon. It can also be used as a verb. For instance: "The earth orbits around the Sun." The word ‘revolves' has the same meaning
column4: but 'rotates' is the spin of the object. Many years ago
column5: people thought that the Sun orbits in a circle around the earth. Every morning the Sun came up in the east and went down in the west. It just seemed to make sense that it was going around the earth. But now
column6: thanks to people like Copernicus and Galileo Galilei
column7: we know that the Sun is the center of the Solar System
column8: and the earth orbits around it. Isaac Newton discovered that gravity controls the orbit of the planets and moons. Since a satellite is an object in space that revolves around another object
column9: the earth is a satellite of the sun
column10: just like the moon is a satellite of the Earth! The sun has lots of satellites orbiting around it
